availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Christopher Marion Lillard (Anderson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Anderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Frances A. McGuire Lillard in Anderson County on October 26, 1843. Father of Sarah H. Lillard, Robert M. Lillard, Mary W. Lillard, Marion Lillard, Samuel Lillard, Minerva Lillard, and Alma Lillard. Farmer in Anderson County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Anderson County in 1850. Farmer in Anderson County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Anderson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 196A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 89.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 18.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 26A.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000259309, p. 255.
Find A Grave, "Christopher Marion Lillard (1819-1910)," Memorial #106797897, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/106797897 (accessed September 10, 2018).
